attributes.action: Government to create legislation for enforced work experience for MPs and Lords.
attributes.additional_details:
An independent group will be set up to find work experience places for MPs and Lords. The jobs selected will be based upon the proportion of people they employ – 85% of places would be in jobs paying less than £25k/yr.

The MPs and Lords should be paired with someone from an opposing party. The pair will work together for a week to improve cross-party relations. 

This will allow them to experience what work is like for all classes of people. Thus, they will be able to make better decisions in parliament.
attributes.background: The Government should legislate for compulsory work experience for all politicians. The duration of which should be for one week per year in a randomly assigned position. The program should include some civil servants.

rejection.details: This would be the responsibility of individual MPs not the UK Parliament and Government.
